entry.title: Re: How to get WSL to TSL

entry.title: A Smarter Move from Boomi and MuleSoft to SAP Integration Suite - Assessed, Automated, Validated
entry.content:
We are living in an era of intelligent transformation, a time when the convergence of digital, physical, and biological worlds is reshaping every facet of our existence. Businesses are evolving with almost breathless speed, with enterprises expanding and adopting new applications, systems, and business models. However, this rapid evolution brings forth a surge in complexity, compelling enterprises to modernise their integration landscape in order to simplify connectivity, improve agility, and reduce operational overhead.

Imagine if your systems spoke the same language, data didn‚Äôt wait in queues, processes moved with instinct, and not instruction, that‚Äôs where SAP Integration Suite takes the lead, not just as a replacement for legacy platforms but as a strategic enabler of digital transformation and landscape consolidation. It silently conducts the symphony weaving APIs, events, processes, and data into a seamless rhythm. Just flowing‚Ä¶.

Why Enterprises Are Making the Shift with SAP Integration Suite

Many organisations who started their journey with legacy middleware are now facing:

  • Fragmented integration landscapes across multiple middleware technologies
  • Rising costs associated with platform sprawl
  • Limited visibility and control over end-to-end processes
  • Challenges in scaling integrations across hybrid and multi-cloud environments

SAP Integration Suite provides a compelling alternative offering native integration with SAP and non-SAP systems, support for hybrid and cloud-native scenarios, and a suite of capabilities for API management, event-driven integration, and process orchestration all in one platform. Cohesion becomes essential when the architecture spans multiple middleware solutions. Consolidating your middleware landscape under one middleware platform brings tangible benefits to an enterprise as it reduces total cost of ownership(TCO) through fewer platforms to manage, maintain and operate. In SAP centric environment, moving to SAP Integration Suite has its advantages. However, the path to consolidation isn‚Äôt always straightforward, especially if the customer‚Äôs landscape has mature middleware platforms like Boomi and MuleSoft.

 Advantages of SAP Integration Suite over Boomi and MuleSoft

  • Smooth Migration from SAP PO/PI
    • SAP Integration Suite: Provides migration automation tool with message mapping automation from SAP PI/PO to SAP IS ensuring smoother transition.
    • MuleSoft/Boomi: No direct migration path, customers must redesign integrations from scratch
  • Pre-Package Integration content
    • SAP Integration Suite: Access to SAP API Business Hub with hundreds of pre-built integration flows (iFlows), APIs, and event packages specifically for SAP business processes.
    • MuleSoft/Boomi: Offer generic templates and accelerators but limited in-depth SAP
  • Native SAP Connectivity
    • SAP Integration Suite: Comes with pre-built adapters and deep integration with SAP applications (S/4HANA, ECC, SuccessFactors, Ariba, Concur, IBP, etc.), ensuring faster implementation and reduced customization.
    • MuleSoft & Boomi: Require third-party connectors or additional customization to integrate seamlessly with SAP landscapes.

Simplifying Migration from MuleSoft and Boomi with an End-to-End Migration Accelerator Tool

To support enterprises who are on a journey to migrate from MuleSoft and Boomi to SAP Integration Suite, we have developed a purpose-crafted accelerator that streamlines the entire lifecycle of migration from MuleSoft and Boomi to SAP Integration Suite. This tool helps assess, automate, validate, and govern migrations at scale reducing manual effort, improving accuracy, and accelerating time to value.

Here‚Äôs how it works:

Migration Assessment for MuleSoft & Boomi

  • Analyze's source artifacts (zip/process archives)
  • Identifies APIs, Processes/ Flows, connectors, and backend systems
  • Calculates integration complexity
  • Recommends equivalent SAP adapters
  • Produces a detailed PDF migration report to drive stakeholder alignment

Automated i-Flow Generation

  • Reconstructs source logic into SAP Integration Suite i-Flows
  • Uses pre-built templates for common patterns
  • Offers SAP aligned adapter recommendations through template iflows.
  • Reduces development effort by up to 30%

Mapping Logic Migration

      MuleSoft

  • Parses complex MuleSoft DWL scripts
  • Supports in conversion of DWL to Graphical mapping formats
  • Preserves nested structures and transformation logic
  • Enables plug-and-play use in SAP Integration Suite

      Boomi

  • Conversion of JavaScript to Groovy Script mapping using AI.

Validation & Testing Framework

  • Validation of migrated interfaces.
  • Compares payloads across source and target middleware and flags discrepancies.
  • Reduces test effort significantly.
  • Visual representation of the test results.

Quality Monitoring & Governance Dashboards: enhancing the existing Product monitoring capabilities

  • Provides near real-time visibility into migrated integration flows and API's enhancing the product monitoring capability
  • Customized monitoring alerts and reports of the interfaces based on filters set, through email alerts.
  • Tracks SLA compliance, error trends, and integration health at tenant level
  • AI enabled Error Info chatbot which provides potential causes if error and suggestions  to fix.
  • Version Management dashboard across all tenant in the account.
  • Certificate lifecycle management.
  • Alerting mechanism for failed transactions improving the response time of maintenance and support team.

AI Chatbot for auto documentation of Migration project

  • Generates documents (technical specification, cutover plan etc) associated with migration

So are you ready to modernize Your Middleware Landscape with SAP Integration Suite? Whether you are currently on MuleSoft or Boomi, moving to SAP Integration Suite doesn't have to be daunting. With the right approach and the right tools, you can migrate with confidence, reduce risks, and unlock a future-ready integration landscape with end-to-end automation.

Reach out to learn how we can support your middleware transformation from MuleSoft or Boomi to SAP Integration Suite.

entry.title: Re: New Developer Forums!
entry.content:
Yes, the new forums have RSS feeds, @nicorunge. 
You find the RSS feeds on the individual board levels, so you would need to navigate to the forum you would like to subscribe to and then click the three dots/options menu. 

I will try to explain notifications/subscriptions in detail below: 
1. Developers https://community.sap.com/t5/developers/ct-p/developers - here you can subscribe to the whole category, this subscription sends you notifications on the platform and email notifications according to your account settings. 

2. The individual groups, with both the Forums and Blog posts - here taking ABAP Cloud as an example: https://community.sap.com/t5/abap-cloud/gh-p/abap-cloud - here you have the same subscribe option as above. If you subscribe to content here, it will send you notifications on the platform and email notifications according to your account settings. 

3. The individual group boards, ABAP Cloud Forum: https://community.sap.com/t5/abap-cloud-forum/bd-p/abap-cloudforum-board - here you have both the option to Subscribe and Subscribe to RSS Feed. The Subscribe option is the same as the two options above, and the RSS Feed is the one you are looking for. 
You will find the same options for the blog posts boards as well: https://community.sap.com/t5/abap-cloud-blog-posts/bg-p/abap-cloudblog-board

I hope this helps üôÇ

entry.content:
(re-posting here because not getting much traction under "Tooling (+ SAP Build) Forum").

I've been trying to pass data out (output) of an Automation, into another one, and I'm not able to.  My Output Parameter was always blank.  I had to merge my logic into a single Automation to achieve my solution.

Sample Process:

Parameters of getData Automation:

I found some info that the best way to read from a local Excel file is to use the Excel Cloud Link activity, which is recommended to use a "any" type variable.  This type of variable does not seem to support LISTS either.  I then learned that the TRY statement creates an isolated local "visibility" layer, so I created my "global" variable outside this TRY later.  I tried different ways to pass the Excel data to my global variable (both work) but I cannot pass the data to my Automation Output Parameter.

Can someone please confirm that LISTS of type ANY/Custom are not supported as Parameters of Automations?

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: Manual Accrual getting reversed at the time of Delta...
entry.content:
Hi @priya_sshekhar ,

I agree with @GauthierVictor and @Lakshmipathi that the recommended approach is to include the legacy data somehow into the business volume (Multiple options exist like proforma documents or an additional business volume table). Both also listed some other reasonable options.

Another option is the use of an absolut amount accrual condition. The first delta accrual will post this accrual. The absolut amount delta accrual is independent from the business volume. Absolut amount accrual and business volume related accrual add up. Both are reversed during final settlement.

 You find further documentation in  2564353 - Condition Contract Management: Product Overview Documents - SAP for Me. From there you can access the document "Condition Contracts for Fixed Amounts". Slide 36 is the best match for your requirement. In your case you only need a single accrual condition and a fixed settlement condition is not required.

entry.title: Re: The description of the cost center are not displayed.
entry.content:
Hello @suyoung_choi3 

You‚Äôre right to point this out‚ÄîS/4HANA Public Cloud operates on UTC, and not all apps convert timestamps to the user‚Äôs local time. Some Fiori apps respect the user‚Äôs Language & Region ‚Üí Time Zone setting; others, particularly classic UIs or specific apps, display UTC. This is intentional, not a flaw. SAP Support Portal-3514300 - Time zone Explanation - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In your example of Manage Global Hierarchies (F2918), the process is date-driven. The outcomes are based on the Valid On key date, which is a date field. Therefore, whether the time is local or UTC does not affect what you see; it is the selected date and the validity of hierarchy nodes/texts over time that matter. If users believe the data is incorrect, they should first verify the Valid On date. SAP Help Portal

If you're looking for a practical way ahead, here‚Äôs a clear plan.

Make it reproducible: demonstrate one app that converts to local time and another that displays UTC, with your FLP time-zone setting visible. Some UI5 apps honour FLP time-zone configuration; see recent UI5/Fiori guidance, SAP Community-Smart Controls Support Time-Zone Configuration from the SAP Fiori Launchpad

You may ask SAP to standardise TZ handling across apps via Customer Influence, with a clear request: apply the user‚Äôs FLP time zone consistently to all Fiori apps that display timestamps. SAP Community-SAP Continuous Influence for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition - Session List and Rules of Engagement

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Responsible Vibe Coding Tutorial: Building a Meeting Room CAP App
entry.content:
üéØWhat is Vibe Coding?

Vibe coding means collaborating with AI assistants to build apps step by step, entirely through natural language prompts. Instead of writing everything yourself, you ‚Äúvibe‚Äù with AI to generate, refine, and optimize code.

This tutorial shows how to build a Meeting Room Booking app with CAP + AI Core, entirely through prompts ‚Äî from schema to service, business logic, AI integration, and a simple UI.

 

Quick prerequisites

  • VS Code + Cline extension (or your Claude integration)
  • Node.js (v18+) and @SAP/cds-dk (CAP CLI)
  • SAP BTP account with AI Core (for production); we include a dev fallback.
  • Git repo and .clinerules set up (recommended)

Step 0 ‚Äî Plan first (Cline Plan mode)

Always start with a short Plan prompt to the AI (Cline Plan mode). Example plan template:

Plan:

- Goal: Add a MeetingRoom CAP service with Book/Cancel/Search and a recommendRoom AI action.

- Acceptance criteria: CDS created + seed data; BookService exposing actions; recommendRoom returns top-3 rooms with reasons; endpoints testable via curl.

- Assumptions: No auth (dev), timezone = UTC, single-tenant.

- Edge cases: overlapping bookings, zero-capacity rooms, invalid room IDs.

- Tests: curl examples for create/search/recommend and a UI smoke test.

Part 1: Setting Up the Environment

üé§The Prompt:

Set up a new CAP project for a meeting room booking system.

üí°What Happened:
The AI guided installation, created a new CAP project, and initialized dependencies.

Generated Commands:

npm install -g @SAP/cds-dk

cds init meeting-vibe

cd meeting-vibe

npm install

Key Learning: Always start with a clean project skeleton before vibing features.

Part 2: Creating the Data Model

üé§The Prompt:

Create a data model with Rooms and Bookings. Rooms have capacity, location, amenities, and availability. Bookings track user, room, start/end times, and status. Include seed data.

üí°What Happened:
The AI generated the core CDS schema and sample CSV seed files.

üìÇGenerated Schema:

namespace vibe.meetings;

 

entity Rooms : cuid, managed {

  name      : String(111) not null;

  location  : String(111);

  capacity  : Integer;

  amenities : String;

  available : Boolean default true;

}

 

entity Bookings : cuid, managed {

  room    : Association to Rooms;

  userId  : String(36);

  start   : Timestamp;

  end     : Timestamp;

  purpose : String(255);

  status  : String(20) default 'CONFIRMED';

}

Key Learning: A single domain-level prompt is enough to generate a correct schema with relationships.

Part 3: Adding the Service Layer

üé§The Prompt:

Expose the Rooms and Bookings as a BookingService with actions: bookRoom, cancelBooking, searchAvailableRooms, and recommendRoom.

üí°What Happened:
The AI produced a full CDS service definition.

üìÇGenerated Service Definition:

service BookingService {

  entity Rooms as projection on vibe.meetings.Rooms;

  entity Bookings as projection on vibe.meetings.Bookings;

 

  action bookRoom(roomId: UUID, userId: String, start: Timestamp, end: Timestamp, purpose: String) returns Bookings;

  action cancelBooking(bookingId: UUID) returns String;

  function searchAvailableRooms(start: Timestamp, end: Timestamp, minCapacity: Integer) returns array of Rooms;

  action recommendRoom(start: Timestamp, end: Timestamp, attendees: Integer, prefs: String) returns array of {

    roomId: UUID;

    score: Decimal(5,2);

    reason: String;

  };

}

Key Learning: The AI can infer the exact CRUD operations and business functions you need if you describe them clearly.

Part 4: Business Logic Implementation

üé§The Prompt:

Implement handlers for bookRoom, cancelBooking, and searchAvailableRooms in JavaScript with validation and error handling.

üí°What Happened:
The AI generated a srv/book-service.js with full logic for booking, cancelling, and searching.

üìÇExample Implementation:

this.on('bookRoom', async (req) => {

  const { roomId, userId, start, end, purpose } = req.data;

  if (new Date(start) >= new Date(end)) req.error(400, 'Invalid time range');

  const overlap = await SELECT.one.from(Bookings).where`room=${roomId} AND start < ${end} AND end > ${start}`;

  if (overlap) req.error(409, 'Room already booked');

  const booking = await INSERT.into(Bookings).entries({ room_ID: roomId, userId, start, end, purpose });

  return booking;

});

Key Learning: When you ask for validation + error handling, the AI adds production-quality safeguards.

Part 5: AI-Powered Recommendations

üé§The Prompt:

Add AI integration with SAP AI Core to suggest the best rooms. Include a fallback heuristic when AI Core is not configured.

üí°What Happened:
The AI created srv/ai-recommender.js, with both AI Core and fallback logic.

üìÇExample Snippet:

async recommendRooms({ start, end, attendees, prefs, rooms }) {

  if (!this.config.clientId) {

    return rooms.map(r => ({

      roomId: r.ID,

      score: r.capacity >= attendees ? 80 : 50,

      reason: `Capacity ${r.capacity} vs ${attendees}`

    })).slice(0,3);

  }

  // AI Core integration here...

}

Key Learning: Always request a fallback path ‚Äî AI assistants can build graceful degradation into your app.

Part 6: Building a Simple UI

üé§The Prompt:

Create a simple SAP UI5 page with fields for start/end time, attendees, preferences, and a button to call recommendRoom. Show results in a table.

üí°What Happened:
The AI created view/Main.view.xml with a table bound to the recommendation endpoint.

üìÇExample View Snippet:

<VBox>

  <DateTimePicker id="start"/>

  <DateTimePicker id="end"/>

  <Input id="attendees" placeholder="Attendees"/>

  <Input id="prefs" placeholder="Preferences"/>

  <Button text="Recommend" press=".onRecommend"/>

  <Table id="tblRooms">...</Table>

</VBox>

Key Learning: Even complex UI scaffolding can be generated quickly when you specify layout + bindings.

Part 7: Documentation & Testing

üé§The Prompt:

Create a TESTING_GUIDE.md with curl commands to test all service actions.

üí°What Happened:
The AI wrote a full Markdown testing guide with:

  • curl for bookRoom, cancelBooking, searchAvailableRooms, recommendRoom
  • expected responses
  • error case examples

Key Learning: Ask for docs and tests explicitly ‚Äî they are as important as code.

üéØBest Practices for Responsible Vibe Coding

  • Engineer > AI: Review, understand, and own every line.
  • Test Before You Trust: Validate edge cases with curl or UI.
  • Plan First: Use Cline Plan mode before big prompts.
  • Fallbacks Matter: Always ask AI to build dev-safe fallbacks.
  • Docs Are Not Optional: Generate and maintain documentation with prompts.

üèóÔ∏è What We Built Together

Through prompts alone, we created:

  • üìäData Layer: Rooms & Bookings entities with seed data
  • üîßBusiness Logic: Booking, cancellation, search with validations
  • ü§ñAI Integration: Room recommendations with AI Core + fallback
  • üé®UI: Simple SAP UI5 page for booking and recommendations
  • üìöDocs: A testing guide for backend and UI

üéâCongratulations!

You‚Äôve just built a Meeting Room Booking CAP app by vibing with AI ‚Äî responsibly. The secret: always combine AI‚Äôs speed with your engineering judgment.

üìñLearn More

  • SAP CAP Documentation
  • SAP AI Core Documentation
  • Cline Extension

Most probably in your source system in IAS source system the affected user does not have a userName configured.

In the joblog, you can set the property "ips.trace.failed.entity.content = true", so you are able to see the content payload from the failed entity.
Probably you'll see the username empty.
   "userName": "",

You can set a userName to the user via the user Management tab and try to sync again.

entry.title: Re: SAP IDM: Digit change on EntryId causes selection of...
entry.content:
Who can access a form depends

  1. on the form's access controls chosen by the form developer at designtime
  2. depending on the the specific access control, on the logged in user's identity, privilege or role assignment at runtime

With these instruments, you can apply functional access control in a pretty straight-forward way, e.g.

  • IDM admins can access all forms
  • business users can only access specific forms like "Change Own Data", "Request New Role" etc.

If you need not only functional, but instance-level access control, such as

  • members of role "ADMIN_US" can access the form "Edit User" only for US-based MX_PERSON
  • members of role "ADMIN_EU" can do the same only for EU-based MX_PERSON

you'll need to go one step further and implement instance-level access control, e.g. using search attribute and user attribute configured on the entry type MX_PERSON. This will control the visibility of MX_PERSON in search. Entries whose search attribute does not match the logged in user's user attribute will be filtered out from search results automatically and hence be hidden.

Form access control's can also be configured to provide instance-level access control, typically by defining (SQL) Filters in the access control's On Behalf Of field.

With all that said, the ability to change the URL is not a problem. With access control properly configured, you can pretty much edit the direct links as you want: you should get an Access Denied response whenever trying a URL to an entry or form that's not allowed for you.

Dear @lockpicking 

In Custom Fields app choose business context below, one for header and second for item

 

After published field, you will be able to add your own field like below (Fiori app Manage Outbound Delivery Orders) in Adapt UI mode: 

 

 

Make the field available to the print form Still in Custom Fields, open your field and enable it for Form Templates / UIs & Reports (data source). If a data source extension is required, follow SAP‚Äôs procedure to extend a form template‚Äôs data source so the custom field appears in the form‚Äôs data connection.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/87f9b54f9c4f4e75aff0061860a6589a/c70d06ed39f34108b520e85dcc7de0c5.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com

Download the form, open it in Adobe LiveCycle Designer, bind your custom field from the data connection and place it on the layout.

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for October 2nd, 2025.

[Kevin] Hey everyone, week one of Devtoberfest is almost over. If you want to check out what activities we've planned for week two, head over to the community, to the Devtoberfest group, and look out for the blog post, Devtoberfest, week two activities. See you there.

[Daniel] I'm here with Pepper, a flat coat retriever, to announce Petoberfest, where you can upload a picture of your pet, or your favorite zoo creature, or stuffed animal, or any furry friend you fancy. Just upload the picture as a comment to my blog post. In addition, use that picture as the basis for an AI-generated image of your pet. For example, hybris Pepper helping me with my Devtoberfest crosswords and wearing her favorite hat. Be creative both in the setup and the style. Petoberfest this year coincides with World Animal Day, so you can also upload a picture of yourself taking part in any animal welfare project. For example, renovating a straight cat hotel or walking to raise money for your local ASPCA. if you upload a picture you will win oodles of points for the devtoberfest grand prize so i'm looking forward to seeing a picture of your pet good news for all you cat fans the rest of the session

[DJ] recordings from recap 2025 are now online on youtube for your queuing and viewing pleasure now we already had the recordings of the sessions from the blue room track on the recap on conference youtube channel and now after getting hold of the recording from the audimax theater we've got the sessions from the yellow room track cut and organized into individual videos and they're in a playlist for you as well the playlist follows the agenda order. And yes, we processed everything with a little bash script and everything on the command line. The future really is terminal.

[Shrini] The scavenger hunt event runs across multiple weeks of Devtoberfest. I hope you already figured out the three clues we gave out and you have a 12-digit hexadecimal number with you. If not, you may pause this video and check out the clues we released earlier from the main blog post on the scavenger end and come back for the fourth clue. For the fourth clue we can explore some github repositories as the clue is hidden in one of the repositories. Many of you may be aware of the SAP GitHub org SAP samples. It contains sample code, TechEd tutorials, Code Jam material and hundreds of reports from which you can learn about ABAP, CAP, BUILD, and other SAP-related technology. Among the various repos, take a closer look at the SAP BTP AI Best Practices repo to find the two-character clue. This repo contains best practices, sample implementations, to build AI-powered applications and serves as a practical guide for developers looking to implement enterprise-grade AI solutions using SAP AI services and integration with generative AI models. To find the clue number four, you don't have to clone the repo. You can look around the repo, access various tabs, search within the repo for some common terms related to desktop office like build, ABAP, CAP, AI, etc. Happy hunting!

[Witalij] Before we dive in, a quick note. Our cat Felicia decided it was the perfect time for an app, so she's not joining today. But I'm here and there is plenty to share. We've just released the third SAP HANA Cloud update of 2025, packed with meaningful advancements. Here are a few highlights I've personally chosen. Vector embedding SQL functions now supports the generative AI hub, helping you integrate different models more easily. JSON is now a native data type in the document store, simplifying work with the unstructured data. Single sign-on for data lake files enhances security and accessibility. And with drill in SAP build code, you can generate SQL from natural language, making development faster and more intuitive, and you can feel like a wipe coder now. For all the details, check out the dedicated blog post or the product team's teaser video. If data modeling is your focus. Don't miss Jan Zwickal's deep-dive post on the latest in graphical view modeling. He also spoke at Devtoberfest this week. Recordings are already available, if you missed it. Finally, mark your calendar for next Thursday as well, as Christoph Morgan will explore developing AI-driven SAP HANA Cloud applications live at Devtoberfest. It's a great chance to see these features in action? Let us know what stands out to you.

[Tom] If you're in the India region, we've got an interesting opportunity for you to join the SAP TechEd On Tour in Bangalore coming up at the end of November. The community talk call for speakers is now open. If you're interested in sharing your experience or your knowledge about a particular topic in the SAP Space, this is your opportunity to get a free lecture only ticket to the SAP TechEd on Tour taking place in Bangalore. You only have until October 10th to submit your session proposal, so be sure to act quickly. We look forward to seeing you at TechEd Berlin as most of the developer advocates team will be there. We'll be cheering you on and helping mentor you for your presentation as well. So this is a great opportunity for anybody looking to get a ticket to TechEd on Tour Bangalore and to share their knowledge at the event. So look forward to seeing you there.

[Nico] Hi everyone and welcome to the developer news. Your 5-card 2025 in Bangalore is going to happen in December and the call for proposals is now open. You can submit your session proposal until October 31st. There is quickfire presentations, around 20 minutes long, in-depth sessions, 40 minutes, or longer hands-on workshops. Definitely check that out if you want to have a session at UI5Con in Bangalore. Also related to UI5, there is a new version of the SAP UI5 RoadMavic store with some interesting items on there regarding AI, obviously. There is new AI related controls and also interesting MCP items. So definitely check that one out if you are interested in SAPUI5. All right, hope to talk to you soon. Bye.

entry.title: Re: Unable to Edit Project Scope ‚Äì "Edit Project Scope" O...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

I hope you are well.

I can see as per screenshot that change project is in status "Closed".
You are not able to edit the scope once project has been closed.

In order to edit the scope, you need to create a copy solution profile from production to test tenant, edit the scope in test tenant and test the features changed, once it is done, you need to merge the project and activate its solution capabilities to the changed reflects in the productive tenant.

1922087- How to Create a Change Project and Its Lifecycle
https://me.sap.com/notes/1922087

In case you have any further questions or issues, please reach out to me and I'll be glad to help. 

Have a great day!  

Best regards, 

Tiago 
SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Production order scheduling issue
entry.content:
We are using basic scheduling with backward scheduling enabled, and the production scheduling profile has the indicator checked for "scheduling upon release of order." The material is set up with 6 days of in-house manufacturing time.

When MRP runs and creates a planned order, the system correctly considers the 6 working days specified in the material master's In-house field. For example, if the end date is calculated as 10/10/2025, MRP sets the start date 6 working days before that.

However, when we convert the planned order into a production order, the system does not consider the 6 working days. Instead, it sets both the start date and end date as 10/10/2025 (start date same as the end date), rather than calculating the start date as 6 days earlier.

entry.title: Why is BOM Header Not Transferred to Project in Auto BOM Transfer (VC / PS Integration)?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are working with a Project System + Variant Configuration (VC) scenario.

‚Ä¢ In the sales order, the item material is the BOM header (configured material).

‚Ä¢ During automatic BOM transfer to the project from Order BOM, only the components are  transferred into the project/WBS/network ‚Äî the BOM header itself is not transferred(SO Item Material).

‚Ä¢ We ran MRP and able to create Planed order for sub components but not for the header. The business team now wants to be able to create a production order for the BOM header directly from the project as it is a Finished Good.

‚Ä¢ Their concern is: if the BOM header is only produced via sales order ‚Üí PP , why do we need PS at all?

My questions are:

1. Is it standard SAP behavior that auto BOM transfer into PS only brings in components, not the BOM header? If so, how do I create Prod order for Order BOM header. 

2. If yes, what is the standard process to handle production of the BOM header material in a PS + VC integration scenario?

3. Is there any way (config or enhancement) to also transfer the BOM header into the project so that production order creation can happen from PS?Because it‚Äôs not making sense to me with components requirement generated from PS without the header.

entry.title: Re: Why asset doest not have material code in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud (scope item J62), the system creates the asset automatically at PO creation, not at GR. This is standard design; there is no option to shift creation to GR. If you need that behaviour, it will require a Customer Influence request.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Why asset doest not have material code in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, migrating BUT000 Business Partner) Texts are not directly supported through the standard Migration Cockpit. Here's what you can do.

Migration Cockpit: Verify if there are any specific templates for Business Partner texts. If none are available, you will need to consider custom solutions.s.

APIs: Utilise OData or REST APIs for Business Partner data migration. Check for BUPA_TEXT_CREATE or similar endpoints for texts.

Fiori Apps: utilise the "Manage Business Partner Master Data" app for bulk data maintenance, which may involve manually adding or editing business partner texts.

Custom Solution: If APIs and Fiori apps don't meet your needs, develop a custom migration script to upload texts via APIs or batch processing.

If it's a significant migration, collaborating with SAP support or an integration partner might be beneficial.

With kind regards

Chuma

Hi, in S/4HANA Public Cloud, custom fields can only be mapped into existing XML structures through extensibility and exposed mapping. You cannot add new XML nodes outside the official schema. If this is a legal requirement, you should submit an SAP Support incident or a Customer Influence request.

entry.title: Re: Class for each equipment or product cannot be assigne...
entry.content:
Hello @Simon_Lehnert 

You‚Äôre using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and facing a common issue: mass-updating class or characteristic assignments after migration. Let me explain it step by step.

Current Situation

Products (Product and product Master): 3,000 migrated, with no class or characteristic assignments.

Equipment (Plant Maintenance / Asset Management): approximately 30,000 migrated, also without class/characteristic assignments.

Classification system: Classes and characteristics have already been migrated to Type 300, Brand 400, Model 3,000

Issue: Migration Cockpit Migrate Your Data lacks fields for classification values within product/equipment templates. There is no mass change application available for classification.

Note:

 In the Public Cloud, migration templates cover only the core master data, Product and Equipment.

Classification values are managed in separate object tables, such as AUSP, KSSK, and INOB and are not embedded in Product/Equipment templates.

Options in Public Cloud

Migration Object Classification

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Migrate Your Data with Migration Cockpit (F3473)

Data Migration via APIs

For Products: API_CLFN_CLASSIFICATION_SRV-Class Data for Classification

For Equipment: API_EQUIPMENT_CLASSIFICATION_SRV

Workaround with Custom Fields
Use CFL if only reporting/search is needed. SAP Help-Custom Fields App and Custom Logic App

Best Practice: Use the Classification migration object for initial load; use the APIs for ongoing updates.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Why HU_label is printed even though HU Step is set to...
entry.content:
Hi @ST24 

Thank you for your question.

Consult Output Management for Warehouse Order Documents & Output Parameter Determination for more details.

To summarise, the HU label printing for pick-Hus is controlled through BRF+ Output Parameter Determination in public cloud. By default, SAP delivers an active rule with dispatch time = immediate for HU_LABEL, which is why your labels are printing automatically even though you defined custom determination rule.

You can resolve this by reviewing the HU output determination rules in the Output Parameter Determination app √† Application = Warehouse Management, Object Type = Handling Unit. Either deactivate or adopt the delivered HU_LABEL rule or change the dispatch time to Manual or Scheduled if you do not want labels to print automatically when HU is created.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Regarding the Logic of Custom Business Objects
entry.content:
Hello @yukitsumura 

Thank you for your question.

Consult Custom Business Objects, Extensibility Options & Custom Business Objects, Fields, and Logic  for more details.

The easiest way to restrict a custom field on Business Partner master data to valid valued from a custom Business Object is to define the CBO as the value help for that field in the Custom Fields and Logic app. This ensures users can only select from predefined entries during BP registration.

However, if you also need to block invalid values entered through APIs or mass upload, you must add a validation BAdI in the Business Partner business context. E.g. BUSINESSPARTNER_CHECK. In this logic, compare the custom field value with your CBO entries and raise an error if it does not exist. This will provide full enforcement beyond the UI.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Success Factor ecp to S4H Public Cloud Integration
entry.content:
Good day @GAK1 

Thank you for your question.

Please note that only one controlling area (A000) is permitted in public cloud. If Employee Central Payroll has multiple controlling areas such as 1000,2000,3000, you cannot replicate them directly into S/4H. The standard approach is to use value mapping during replication: either in the Business Integration Builder framework or in SAP Cloud Integration. There you can map all ECP controlling areas to the single controlling area A000 in S/4H. This way, all validations in S/4H will succeed, while ECP can still maintain its multiple areas.

Consult Business Integration Builder (BIB) Knowledge & Maintain the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Value Mapping for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Cannot edit Bookpage
entry.content:
Hi Sanchia,

The Book Page has been incorrectly created, your Start Page is an actual Book Page template, not a Book Page created with reference to a Book Page template.  You should have a Book Page template that contains all of the common information that you expect to appear on Book Pages created from that template.  So, you should have a Book Page template for the Start Page and a second template for the End Page.

Once you have to two templates, which contain the common objects expected on those corresponding pages, e.g. a Logo, you can then use those templates to create Book Page.  To do that:

1. Click on the Simulation object
2. Click the yellow plus icon on the toolbar to create a new object
3. Select the Book Page object
4. Give the Book Page a name and make sure that the template field contains the template to be used for this page, e.g. the Start Page template
5. Click OK.

Please look at this video to understand more about create Book Page templates and Book Pages from those templates.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: Re: Rejection EDocument Cockpit
entry.content:
Hello @Jessicaaguilar1 

Thank you for your question.

The reject error you received occurs because the field NumSerieFacturaEmisor must follow AEAT‚ÄôS specific format for complementary customs settlement invoices which is D7. In Spain, this number must reference the original customs settlement with a complementary suffix, e.g. 2023ES123456/01. If you use a standard invoice number format, AEAT will reject it.

Please check that in your SAP configuration, the reference Code mentioned earlier is filled with the DUA number in the correct format.

Consult SII tip for Spain #2: Reuse <NumSerieFacturaEmisor> in case of de-registered invoices, AEAT Certificates for SII ‚Äî Spain & 2872857 - eDocument Spain Troubleshooting Guide for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris
